"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b2f53d636872772e000d5d#post_55b2f53d636872772e000d5d
[bq="uc9"]"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b2f3fd636872772e000b70#post_55b2f3fd636872772e000b70
Problems with time travel:
1)Exotic particles
2)"Ripping"
3)Subspace bubbles
4)Accelerated heat death inside the subspace bubble
5)There would be no way of getting back into your original universe
6)Accelerated spacial expansion

Essentially if you time traveled you would be destroyed in every possible way and even in some impossible ways.[/bq]
ill show u what i mean

topics.body:
"@Kaz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b2fc2863687276bc000459#post_55b2fc2863687276bc000459

Kaz. Again.

You're not talking about time traveling (Going from point A to Point Z, then watch the ramifications that go between points A trough A.1 in an established timeline), this is slowing time for a group of people still on Point A and never leaving Point A.

You're talking about facilitating going from New York to Rhode Island in 3 seconds then compare how that affected you, instead of going from New York 2015 to Rhode Island 1776 and see how you affected both timelines.

topics.body:
"@Kaz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b2fda163687276bc0005c9#post_55b2fda163687276bc0005c9

Oh dear dende... The one that goes not forward only but back and forth in-between.

As in. Go from 2015 to 2020, take something from the 2020's then go back to 1880 give them what you brought and see how the 2015 of that timeline is affected by that, savvy?
